comments.body:
what happens if $KUBE_GCE_MASTER_IMAGE file is not present?
(if users override KUBE_GCE_MASTER_IMAGE, will this get affected?)

In this context, if `JENKINS_GCI_IMAGE_FAMILY` is set, `KUBE_GCE_MASTER_IMAGE` will always be overridden to the latest GCI build, disregarding what user sets.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/hack/jenkins/e2e-runner.sh#L236
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/hack/jenkins/e2e-runner.sh#L197

Humm.. that doesn't guarantee that information is present in the GCS bucket though, right? May be we should properly handle the 'gsutil' command failure in general (log error and exit?).

Also, if `JENKINS_GCI_IMAGE_FAMILY` and `KUBE_GCE_MASTER_IMAGE` are assumed, then we should probably add check/assert for them to be non-empty at the beginning of the function? or at least mention in the comment above this function that they are assumed?

This script has exit on error set, so if anything returns non 0, it will exit and show the last error.

Again, assert won't be very useful with exit on error, but comments will be helpful. I'll add those.
Done

comments.body: What is this environment variable used for?

It's used to determine which version of k8s to download, and to use in test.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/hack/jenkins/e2e-runner.sh#L285
IMO the image description is not the most reliable source to determine K8s version installed on the image.  Did you have any other options in mind?

Yes, I actually had a more reliable way implemented before I sent this PR
out. I think that one is going to take sometime to go through review, so
this can go in first to get us going. WDYT?

comments.body: Why set + here and then re-set - below?

for xtrace, if we leave it on, it will trace all commands in juLog, which is way too noisy. 

juLog made the assumption that nounset and errexit were not set. I want to ensure it won't exit accidentally.

comments.body: nit: quotes `"${version_re}"`

I have been following the [bash 3.2 guide](http://www.tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/bashver3.html#REGEXMATCHREF) on using regular expression by not quoting them:

```
In fact, quoting in this context is not advisable as it may cause regex evaluation to fail.
```
Ah, okay. Good :)
